div.title: How to see a Summary table
div.h4: How to see a Summary table.

ul.li: port : port of database cluster instance
snap_begin : start point in this report
snap_end : end point in this report
total_commits : total commit transactions in this database cluster
total_rollbacks : total rollback transactions in this database cluster

div.title: How to see a Database Statistics table
div.h4: How to see a Database Statistics table.

ul.li: hit% : cache hit's rate (shared_buffers hit's rate)
gets/s : read blocks from disk and disk cache per second
reads/s : read blocks from disk per second
rows/s : number of rows from tables and indexes per second

div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion

div.title: How to see a Transaction Statistics graph
div.h4: How to see a Transaction Statistics graph.

ul.li: [database name] commit_tps : commited transactions of [database name] per second (xact/s)
[database name] rollback_tps : rollback transaction of [database name] per second (xact/s)

div.title: How to see a Database Size
div.h4: How to see a Database Size table.

div.title: How to see a Recovery Conflicts table
div.h4: How to see a Recovery Conflicts table.

ul.li: conflict tblspc : number of query cancels by conflict with deleted table space
conflict lock : number of query cancels by conflict with database locks
conflict snapshot : number of query cancels by conflict with VACUUM in tuples
conflict bufferpin : number of query cancels by conflict with VACUUM in shared_buffers
conflict deadlock : number of query cancels by deadlocks

div.title: How to see a WAL Statistics graph
div.h4: How to see a WAL Statistics(total) graph.

ul.li: write_total : total size of WAL(xlog) data in this report (MiB)
write_speed : average size of WAL(xlog) data in this report (MiB)

div.h4: How to seea WAL Statistics graphs.

ul.li: y axis1 (left) : size of WAL(xlog) data per snapshot (Bytes)
y axis2 (right) : size of WAL(xlog) data per second (Bytes/s)
write_size : size of WAL output / snapshot time (Bytes)
write_size_per_sec : size pf WAL output / second (Bytes/s)

div.title: How to see a Instance Processes Ratio table
div.h4: How to see a Instance Processes Ratio table.

ul.li: idle (%) : ratio of idle backend process (%)
idle in xact (%) : ratio of idle backend process in transaction (%)
waiting (%) : ratio of waiting backend process by locks (%)
running (%) : ratio of running backend process in transaction (%)

div.title: How to see a Instance Processes graph
div.h4: How to see a Instance Processes graph.

ul.li: idle : ratio of idle backend process (%)
idle in xact : ratio of idle backend process in transaction (%)
waiting : ratio of waiting backend process by locks (%)
running : ratio of running backend process in transaction (%)

div.title: How to see a CPU Usage graph
div.h4: How to see a CPU Usage graph.

ul.li: user : ratio of CPU usage in user mode (%)
system : ratio of CPU usage in system mode (%)
iowait : ratio of CPU usage in iowait (%)
idle : ratio of CPU usage in idle (%)

div.title: How to see a Load Average graph
div.h4: How to see a Load Average graph.

div.title: How to see a I/O Usage table/graph
div.h4: How to see a I/O Usage table/graph.

ul.li: Including TableSpaces : size of table space in a device
total read (MiB) : total read size in a device (MiB)
total write (MiB) : total write size in a device (MiB)
total read time (ms) : total read time in a device (ms)
total write time (ms) : total write time in a device (ms)
current I/O queue : number of current I/O queue in a device
total I/O time (ms) : total time of I/O in a device (ms)

div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion
div.h4: How to see a I/O Size

ul.li: [device] read : read I/O size per second in a device (Bytes/s)
[device] write : write I/O size per second in a device (Bytes/s)

div.h4: How to see a I/O Time

ul.li: [device] avg read time : time of read I/O in a device (sec)
[device] avg write time : time of write I/O in a device (sec)

div.title: How to see a Memory Usage graph
div.h4: How to see a memory Usage graph table.

ul.li: cached : size of file cached(not include buffer cached) (Bytes)

div.title: How to see a Disk Usage per Tablespace table
div.h4: How to see a Disk Usage per Tablespace table.

ul.li: device : device number of directory of tablespace
used (MiB) : usage data size in table space directory device (MiB)
avail (MiB) : avalable data size in table space directory device (MiB)
remain (%) : remain data size in table space directory device

div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion

div.title: How to see a Disk Usage per Table table/graph
div.h4: How to see a Disk Usage per Table table/graph.
div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion
div.h4: How to see a Table Size table.

ul.li: entry : table name [database name].[schema name].[table name])

div.h4: How to see a Disk Read table.

ul.li: entry : table name ([database name].[schema name].[table name])
value : amount of read all blocks (all tables, indexes, TOAST table and TOAST index)

div.title: How to see a Heavily Updated Tables table
div.h4: How to see a Heavily Updated Tables table.

ul.li: UPDATE : number of UPDATE rows (include HOT update)
total : number of INSERT, UPDATE and DELETE rows
HOT (%) : ratio of HOT update rows per all table rows

div.title: How to see a Heavily Accessed Tables table
div.h4: How to see a Heavily Accessed Tables table.

ul.li: seq_scan : time of executing sequential scan
seq_tup_read : rows of sequential scan read
tup_per_seq : rows of sequential scan read per once

div.title: How to see a Low Density Tables table
div.h4: How to see a Low Density Tables table.

ul.li: logical_pages : number of logical pages in all records
physical_pages : number of physical pages in all records
tratio : ratio of logical pages per physical pages

div.title: How to see a Fragmented Tables table
div.h4: How to see a Fragmented Tables table.

ul.li: correlation : correlation of record sort in table

div.title: How to see a Functions table
div.h4: How to see a Functions table.

ul.li: time/call (ms) : total execute time per calls (ms)

div.title: How to see a Statements table
div.h4: How to see a Statements table.

ul.li: User : user name which executed query
Database : database name which was executed query

div.title: How to see a Long Transactions table
div.h4: How to see a Long Transactions table.

ul.li: pid : pid of backend process in long transaction
client address : client ip address of backend process in long transaction
when to start : start time of long transaction
duration (sec) : duration time of long transaction (sec)

div.title: How to see a Lock Activity table
div.h4: How to see a Lock Activity table.

ul.li: database : database name which has lock waiting object
schema : schema name which has lock waiting object
relation : relation name which has lock waiting
duration : duration time which has lock waiting
blockee pid : blockee pid which has lock waiting
blocker pid : blocke pid which has lock
blocker gid : gid of blocker backend
blockee query : executing query which is lock wating in transaction
blocker query : query list which has lock in transaction

div.title: How to see a Checkpoint Activity table
div.h4: How to see a Checkpoint Activity table.

ul.li: total checkpoints : number of total checkpoint
checkpoints by time : number of checkpoint executed by checkpoint_timeout
checkpoints by xlog : number of checkpoint executed by checkpoint segments
avg written buffers : average written buffer size
max written buffers : max written buffer size
avg duration (sec) : average time of checkpoint's duration (sec)
max duration (sec) : max time of checkpoint's duration (sec)

div.title: How to see a Basic Statistics (Average) table
div.h4: How to see a Basic Statistics. (Average)

ul.li: count : number of execute autovaccum autovacuum
avg index scans : number of index scan
avg removed rows : avarage removed rows
avg remain rows : average remain rows

div.title: How to see a I/O Statistics (Average) table
div.h4: How to see a I/O Statistics. (Average)

ul.li: avg page hit : average page hit
avg page miss : average page miss
avg page dirty : average page dirty
avg read rate : average read rate
avg write rate : average write rate

div.title: How to see a Current Replication Status table
div.h4: How to see a Current Replication Status table.

ul.li: client addr : IP address in standby
backend start : start time of walsender walsender
write location : write WAL location in standby (LSN or WAL file name)
flush location : flush WAL location in standby (LSN or WAL file name)
replay location : replay WAL location in standby (LSN or WAL file name)
sync priority : priority of synchronous replication
sync state : state of synchronous replication

div.title: How to see a Replication Delays table
div.h4: How to see a Replication Delays

ul.li:
[address]:[port-number] flush_delay_size : WAL flush-delay between Master and Standby (Bytes)
* Synchronous standby is indicated by [sync]

[address]:[port-number] replay_delay_size : replay-delay between Master and Standby (Bytes)
* Synchronous standby is indicated by [sync]

div.title: How to see a Database table

help.div: How to see a Database table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Schema table

help.div: How to see a Schema table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Table table
div.h4: How to see a Table table.

ul.li: row width : average real columns data size (Bytes)
table scans : number of executing sequential scan
index scans : number of executing index scan

div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion

div.title: How to see a Index table
div.h4: How to see a Index table.

ul.li: table : table name is refferd to index
scans : number of executing index scans
rows/scan : returned rows which is executing once index scan

div.ul: *The small value is displayed as zero by the truncation of the number in unit conversion

div.title: How to see a View table

help.div: How to seea View table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Sequence table

help.div: How to see a Sequence table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Trigger table

help.div: How to see a Trigger table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Role table

help.div: How to see a Role table. This information is not supported in this version. We will support in future version.

div.title: How to see a Parameter table
div.h4: How to see a Parameter table.

div.title: How to see a Alert table
div.h4: How to see a Alert table.
How to change alert settings.
div.p:
Update the alert setting table of the repository DB.
Please see the pg_statsinfo manual for details of the alert settings.

e.g. Change the threshold of Rollback per seconds to "3000".
UPDATE statsrepo.alert SET rollback_tps = 3000 WHERE instid = 1;

div.title: How to see a Profiles table
div.h4: How to see a Profiles table.

div.title: How to use Log Viewer

help.div:
How to use Search Option. To narrow down the log, enter the search criteria and click "Search" button.
ELEVEL : error severity
USERNAME : user name
DATABASE : database name
MESSAGE : error message (POSIX Regular Expressions)
How to see a Log table.
timestamp : timestamp with milliseconds
username : user name
database : database name
pid : process ID
client_addr : client host:port number
session_id : session ID
session_line_num : per-session line number
ps_display : command tag
session_start : session start time
vxid : virtual transaction ID
xid : regular transaction ID
elevel : error severity
sqlstate : SQLSTATE code
message : error message
detail : error message detail
hint : hint
query : internal query that led to the error
query_pos : character count of the error position therein
context : error context
user_query : user query that led to the error
user_query_pos : character count of the error position therein
location : location of the error in the PostgreSQL source code
application_name : application name

error.p: This repository does not have result in this instance.
This pg_statsinfo version is not supported. Please use %s higher.
This PostgreSQL version is not supported. Please use 8.3.x higher.
This repository does not have snapshot at all.Please execute getting snapshot command or wait for few minutes(auto getting snapshot).
does not present a reports. Because repository does not have snapshot at all. Please re-select report term or get snapshot.
